page.title: 13Customs
page.content: The{Kennet Morris Men}visited this area in the summer. As a group they have been formed for 28 years and visit local hostelries in{Berkshire and{south Oxfordshire.}By tradition they perform dances from the{Cotswolds , the{City of Lichfield}and from the {Welsh Borders.}This form of amusement, whose origin or purpose is unclear, have been a feature of Britain at least since the{16th century.}Some suggest that the dances bring good crops and good weather, or that the bells and the handkerchiefs ward off bad spirits and bring fertility to the village. The tradition has been kept alive due to the research of scholars in the late{19th century}and more recently by a{centrally organised {federation.}This arranges conventions and asks groups to perform accurate displays to maintain dancing standards
